level.text: This chapter shall be liberally construed and applied to promote its underlying purposes and policies.
The underlying purposes and policies of this chapter are to:
Simplify and clarify the law concerning the affairs of missing individuals, protected individuals, and incapacitated individuals;

Promote a speedy and efficient system for managing and protecting the estates of protected individuals so that assets may be preserved for application to the needs of protected individuals and their dependents; and

Provide a system of general and limited guardianships for incapacitated individuals and coordinate guardianships and protective proceedings concerned with management and protection of estates of incapacitated individuals.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 6-204
level.text: Law 6-204, the "District of Columbia Guardianship, Protective Proceedings, and Durable Power of Attorney Act of 1986," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 6-7, which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 18, 1986, and December 16, 1986, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 8, 1987, it was assigned Act. No. 6-263 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.

level.heading: Editor’s Notes
level.text: Uniform Law: This section is based upon § 1-102 of the Uniform Guardianship and Protective Proceedings Act (1982 Act).
